chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Assistant District Attorney Ryan Spaude appears on behalf of the State. Attorney Jason Robert Farris appears via Zoom. Marina Andrea Goza appears in custody, in court. Present bond continued
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Marina Andrea Goza in court, in custody at the Brown County Jail.  Attorney Jason Robert Farris in court for Marina Andrea Goza.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin L Steuck in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Not guilty plea entered on all counts
Present bond continued
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Information to be filed.
Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Drug patch was placed.   (Marina was just notified this afternoon that we are pursuing revocation of her Extended Supervision cases.  She will remain in jail until the revocation process is complete, which could take 2-3 months.  Jessica Haines DOC)

Defendant to report to CJS within 24 hours of court or release from custody. 
Defendant to have no contact with child unless authorized by CPS and a long as it does not violate other orders in pending cases.
Pharma patch to be installed before release.
Absolute sobriety.

Defendant Marina Andrea Goza appeared by video, in custody. Attorney C. LaPlant appeared on behalf of the defendant.
Attorney K. Stueck appeared, via zoom, on behalf of the state.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
